section.name: Glossary
section.paragraph: ${software} uses a number of terms you should know when working with the application.

list.item: The menu that appears when you control-click something (with a two-button mouse you can also right-click) and gives access to frequently used commands that deal directly with the clicked object. Read more about the available contextual menus in the "Views"and "Windows" chapters.
A part of the ${software} main windowthat lets you view a document or, if possible, edit it. The view/edit pane displays different viewsdepending on the type of document it shows.
The layout for a ${software} main window.You can change the layout with the commands in the View menu.
The display for the various document types inside the the view/edit pane or a document window. pane. Read more about views here.

${software} uses three different types of windows, main, document and other windows. Main windowsshow the hierarchy and, in some views, also the selected document, whereas document windowsshow documents separately.
The collection of all documents stored in ${software}.
A file in the database, for example a plain or RTF text, a PDF or an image. Technically an entry in the database with text, RTF, or image content. Sometimes referred to as "content".
A file in the database, a plain or RTF text, or a link. Technically an entry in the database with text or RTF content. Sometimes referred to as "content".
A collection of documents or other groups inside the database. Similar to a folder in the file system.

A second "incarnation" of a document or group. Unlike an alias in the file system, a replicant is not a real document pointing to another file, the original, but only a second entry in the table of contents for the very same document. Consequently, there is no original, when you replicate a document you'll end up with two replicants.

Sheets are collections of records, structured sets of data. You can use records to store for example addresses or list items and view all records of a sheet together in a table-like view.Sheets appear in hierarchy lists like folders with an expand/collapse triangle in front of their icon.

section.name: Template tags for Wiki-style links
section.paragraph: When making a new document by marking some words in an RTF document, making them a link and clicking this link, ${software} creates the new document using a template you can define in the preferences panel, "Editing" tab.In this template, you can use the tags below to automatically insert the name of the link, the current date or other information.

list.item: Name of link
A '%' character
Abbreviated weekday name
Full weekday name
Abbreviated month name
Full month name
Shorthand for g%X %x", the locale format for date and time
Day of the month as a decimal number (01-31)
Same as %d but does not print the leading 0 for days 1 through 9
Milliseconds as a decimal number (000-999)
Hour based on a 24-hour clock as a decimal number (00-23)
Hour based on a 12-hour clock as a decimal number (01-12)
Day of the year as a decimal number (001-366)
Month as a decimal number (01-12)
Minute as a decimal number (00-59)
AM/PM designation for the locale
Second as a decimal number (00-59)
Weekday as a decimal number (0-6), where Sunday is 0
Date using the date representation for the locale, including the time zone
Time using the time representation for the locale
Year without century (00-99)
Year with century (such as 1990)
Time zone name (such as Pacific Daylight Time)
Time zone offset in hours and minutes from GMT (HHMM)
